forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog. Partly cloudy, with a low around 50. South southwest wind around 2 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog before 7am. Sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, an ethereal layer of patchy fog lingers, harmonizing with the soft gray light that ushers in the day. The city appears serenely suspended between night and morning, a gentle veil draping the contours of familiar landmarks. The temperature rests comfortably around fifty degrees, suggesting a crispness in the air that invites a light jacket—perfect for an early stroll along the waterfront or a subtle embrace of the city’s electric vibrancy. 

By the late morning, the fog will yield to bright sunshine, illuminating the features of the city with a warm embrace. A high of around sixty-eight awaits, signaling an inviting afternoon where laughter and conversation can flourish in the parks or quaint cafes. As the day progresses, the temperatures will gradually dip, offering a gentle reminder of the cool evenings typical of this coastal haven. It’s a day that entices you to savor a leisurely brunch or embark on an easy-going exploration of hidden alleyways, where the true essence of San Francisco often resides—an adventure awaiting just around the corner.
